175.article_body: Twitter on Thursday announced it has begun testing the 'Edit Tweet' feature with its team internally, adding that its access will be expanded to Twitter Blue subscribers late this month. Twitter stated, "For the test, Tweets will be able to be edited a few times in...30 minutes following their publication. Edited Tweets will appear with an icon, timestamp, and label."

176.title: It's not survey but mini NRC: Owaisi on survey of UP madrassas
176.article_body: After the UP government announced to conduct a survey of unrecognised madrassas in the state, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the BJP "wants to harass Muslims". Owaisi said, "Madrassas are as per Article 30 then why [UP] government has ordered the survey? It's not a survey but a mini NRC." "The state government can't interfere with our rights," he added.

177.title: Water in B'luru lakes unfit for drinking, bathing: Pollution board
177.article_body: None of the 105 lakes in Bengaluru have water fit for drinking or even bathing, the Karnataka State Pollution Control Board has said in its water quality analysis report. The waters have been contaminated by the entry of untreated sewage and industrial effluents, it added. The lake waters can be used for propagation of wildlife, fisheries and irrigation.

178.title: 7 workers of private factory consume poison over salary delay in Indore
178.article_body: Seven employees of a private factory in Indore reportedly consumed a poisonous substance to protest against delayed salaries and transfer to another establishment. They were hospitalised. According to the police, the factory owners had not paid their salaries for months and also transferred the workers to some other place, because of which they were facing a lot of problems.

179.title: Chinooks used by IAF do not have any problems: Boeing India President
179.article_body: After the US Army grounded its fleet of CH-47 helicopters, citing a risk of engine fires, Boeing India President Salil Gupte clarified that the Chinooks used by the Indian Air Force don't have any problems. "IAF contacted our engineers after incidents were reported in the US and have been informed...there's no impact on the helicopter operated by...Indian forces," he said.

180.title: Value of UPI transactions touches all-time high of ₹10.73 lakh cr in Aug
180.article_body: Value of digital payment transactions through UPI touched an all-time high of ₹10.73 lakh crore with 657 crore transactions in August 2022, according to National Payments Corporation of India's (NPCI) latest data. UPI transaction value in July was at ₹10.63 lakh crore with 628 crore transactions. UPI transaction value crossed the ₹10-lakh-crore mark for the first time in May.

181.title: Woman falls off bike as saree gets entangled in wheel, dies in Maha
181.article_body: A 22-year-old woman riding pillion on a motorbike with her husband fell off the vehicle after her saree got entangled in the rear wheel chain of the two-wheeler in Maharashtra, police said. Priti Puchul Shinde died due to severe head injuries. The accident took place on the Amravati-Nagpur Highway at Gondkhairi village of Nagpur district on Monday, police said.

182.title: Raj CM directs officials to repair roads damaged during monsoon
182.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday directed officials to repair roads damaged during this monsoon. Speaking about his visit to Jodhpur, Gehlot said he found that roads in the district were damaged. "Chief engineers, additional chief engineers should conduct field visits," Gehlot said, adding a special campaign will be undertaken from September 5 to October 20 to repair damaged roads.

183.title: Not surprised by personal attacks, won't be deterred: Delhi LG on corruption allegations
183.article_body: Reacting to the allegations of corruption made against him by AAP, Delhi Lieutenant Governor V K Saxena said he won't be surprised if more such "personal" and "baseless" attacks were made against him and his family. "CM Kejriwal...in desperation has resorted to diversionary tactics and false accusations," he tweeted. "I'll under no circumstances...be deterred from constitutional duties," he added.

184.title: Inter-state drug racket busted in Hyd; drugs worth ₹9 lakh seized, 8 held
184.article_body: The Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing on Thursday said they busted an inter-state drug racket and arrested eight people in the case. The sleuths seized 140 grams of hashish, 184 blots of lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD) and 10 grams of MDMA worth ₹9 lakh, an official release said. It added that 30 drug consumers purchasing from the accused were identified.

185.title: Rajeev Sen, Charu Asopa call off their divorce; say 'We've decided to keep our marriage'
185.article_body: Rajeev Sen and Charu Asopa, who had earlier confirmed their separation, have decided to call off their divorce. Sharing a picture on Instagram, Charu wrote, "Happy to announce that we have decided to keep our marriage for good." "We both are blessed with a beautiful daughter...Her upbringing & happiness is our number one priority," she added.

186.title: Two-wheeler financing startup Bike Bazaar raises ₹170 cr in equity funding
186.article_body: As part of its on-going Series D round, two-wheeler financing startup Bike Bazaar has raised ₹170 crore in equity funding. The funding was received from a consortium led by Women's World Banking Asset Management. The firm said that it has raised more than ₹250 crore in debt financing in the last six months from banks and financial institutions.

187.title: PM to inaugurate multiple projects worth ₹3,800 cr in Karnataka
187.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi would visit Karnataka on September 2 and inaugurate various projects undertaken by New Mangalore Port Authority and Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals Limited, which are estimated to be worth ₹3,800 crore. Before his visit to Karnataka, PM Modi will commission India's first indigenous aircraft carrier INS Vikrant at Cochin Shipyard Limited in Kochi.

188.title: Malware uses fake Google Translate app to mine crypto on 1.12 lakh PCs: Report
188.article_body: According to a research by Check Point Research, a malware created by Turkish firm Nitrokod has reportedly been used since 2019 to mine crypto on nearly 1.12 lakh users' personal computers (PCs) without their permission. Hackers wait for a month after the app is installed to start mining crypto to ensure the user doesn't notice changes in PC's power consumption.

189.title: 16 IAS officers transferred in administrational reshuffle in UP
189.article_body: In an administrational reshuffle, Uttar Pradesh government transferred 16 IAS officers. Principal Secretary to the CM, Sanjay Prasad, will now have additional charge of the home department and information department. Navneet Kumar Sehgal has been made Additional Chief Secretary of Sports, while Parth Sarthi Sen Sharma has been appointed Principal Secretary of Health and Family Welfare Department.

190.title: Sanjiv Rangrass to be appointed to board of directors at Zetwerk
190.article_body: Business-to-business (B2B) unicorn Zetwerk will be appointing Sanjiv Rangrass to its board of directors. Rangrass is an angel investor in the contract manufacturing platform and will join as an independent director and board member, Zetwerk said in a statement. He was the former Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of ITC Ltd Agribusiness division, and was with the company for 40 years.

191.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 8 drug peddlers who used crypto as payment
191.article_body: The Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing arrested eight drug peddlers who were using cryptocurrency as payment. The drug trafficking network was operating via the Darknet and the police seized 140 grams of charas, 1450 grams of ganja, 184 LSD blots, and 10 grams of MDMA from them. "The arrests are linked to international cartels," said CV Anand, Commissioner of Police Hyderabad.

192.title: NHAI removing pipelines ahead of Chandani Chowk old bridge demolition
192.article_body: National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) and Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) started the work of removing pipelines above Pune's Chandani Chowk overpass on Wednesday. The pipelines installed around the chowk include water supply pipelines and electricity service lines, among others. They're being removed as the old bridge at the chowk will be demolished between September 12-15, officials said.

193.title: Salman Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16' to premiere in October: Reports
193.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' makers have reportedly locked the premiere date of its upcoming season. The makers of the Salman Khan-hosted reality show are reportedly planning to lock either October 8 or October 9 for Bigg Boss 16's premiere. Earlier, the new season was supposed to launch on October 1, but the makers decided to push it for a week.

194.title: 8 booked for 'hookah, non-veg boat party' on river Ganga in UP's Prayagraj
194.article_body: Police have booked eight persons after a video showing a group of youth smoking hookah and roasting chicken on a boat on river Ganga in Prayagraj went viral on social media. In a statement, the police said a case, charging two named accused and six unidentified people for hurting religious sentiments and defiling a place of worship, has been filed.

195.title: Lufthansa to cancel almost all flights on Friday from 2 German cities amid strike
195.article_body: German airline Lufthansa has said that it will cancel almost all passenger and cargo flights on Friday from Frankfurt and Munich amid a wage dispute. The pilots' union Vereinigung Cockpit demanded 5.5% pay raise this year for more than 5,000 pilots. However, the union's spokesperson said, "We have not received a sufficient offer...this is sobering and a missed opportunity."

196.title: Riteish, Genelia buy BMW iX electric car worth around ₹1.43 crore
196.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh and his wife Genelia Deshmukh bought BMW iX electric car on Ganesh Chaturthi. The two, along with their kids Riaan and Rahyl, were seen arriving at Arpita Khan Sharma and Aayush Sharma's house in their new car, which costs around ₹1.43 crore. The new model is the first-ever all-electric variant of the iX.

197.title: Bengaluru students win Smart India Hackathon, 2022
197.article_body: Bengaluru students have won the finale of Smart India Hackathon (SIH), 2022, held in Mumbai last week. The winning team is from CMR Institute of Technology. They developed a mobile application and site to help farmers select which crop to grow based on water availability. 'Water availability-based crop-specific advisory' was the competition's problem statement given by Union Jal Shakti Ministry.

198.title: 2 JeM terrorists killed in encounter in J&K, 1 civilian injured
198.article_body: Two Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists were killed in an encounter with security forces in the Sopore area of J&K, police said on Thursday. The encounter reportedly broke out on Wednesday night after the security forces launched a cordon-and-search operation. The terrorists were reportedly planning attacks on civilians in Sopore area. Notably, a civilian also suffered injuries in the exchange of fire.

199.title: Car runs over labourers sleeping at bus stand in Thane; 4 injured
199.article_body: A speeding car allegedly ran over four labourers sleeping at a bus stand, injuring them in Thane on Wednesday. According to police, the labourers, aged between 30 and 60, were sleeping on a pavement near the canteen when the incident happened. Others who were sleeping there woke up and rushed the labourers to a hospital where they are undergoing treatment.

200.title: Don't eff this up: Bezos recalls warning from son for Lord of Rings' prequel
200.article_body: Ahead of the debut of The Lord of the Rings' prequel 'Rings of Power' on Amazon's Prime Video, Jeff Bezos revealed a conversation he had with his son. He said, "My son came up to me one day, he looked me in the eyes, very sincerely, and he said: 'Dad, please don't eff this up'...And he was right."

201.title: Rahul's 36, Kohli's fifty, Jadeja's bowling, all positives from India vs HK: Irfan
201.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said KL Rahul's 36-run innings, Virat Kohli's half-century, Suryakumar Yadav's batting and Ravindra Jadeja's bowling were some of the positives from India's Asia Cup match against Hong Kong. "Kohli's half-century is the biggest positive because of the way he batted...You see the score but we here see how he played...he [was] in control," added Irfan.

202.title: 2 electrocuted, 3 injured during Ganesh Chaturthi procession in Tamil Nadu
202.article_body: Two people were electrocuted to death and three suffered injuries during a Ganesh Chaturthi procession in Tamil Nadu's Virudhunagar district. The incident occurred at around 10:30 pm on Wednesday after the chariot came in contact with an electric transformer at Sokanathan Puthur. Those injured are undergoing treatment at Government Hospital in Sivagiri, District Collector J Meghanath Reddy said.

203.title: EU mulls over capping energy prices, cutting electricity demand
203.article_body: The European Commission is looking into measures to cap energy prices and cut electricity demand, Mechthild Wörsdörfer, Deputy Director General of the European Commission's energy department said. She mentioned that European Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen will outline ideas on capping energy prices on September 14. Russia had cut gas deliveries to Europe which led to rise in prices.

204.title: Employment rate among youth at 5-year low: BJP MP Varun Gandhi
204.article_body: Citing the CMIE data, BJP MP Varun Gandhi said the employment rate among youth is at a five-year low. "Employment rate among youth has come down from 20.9% to 10.4%," Varun Gandhi tweeted. "Recently, PM urged all the departments to fill up 10 lakh posts lying vacant but till now, no department could formulate a concrete action plan," he added.

205.title: 134 artificial ponds created for immersion of Ganesh idols in Navi Mumbai
205.article_body:
The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has created 134 artificial ponds for immersion of Ganesh idols. NMMC chief Abhijit Bangar inspected a few sites to check the arrangements and 
directed municipal officials to physically inspect natural and artificial immersion sites. In addition to the artificial ponds, there are 22 natural ponds where devotees can immerse idols.

206.title: Paytm transaction of ₹100 leads Delhi police to accused in ₹4 cr heist
206.article_body: A Paytm transaction of ₹100 led to the arrest of four suspects in a robbery case of a jewellery consignment worth ₹4 crore in Delhi. Police had found that one of the accused took ₹100 from a cab driver after transferring him the money digitally. Delhi police approached the Paytm headquarters, got his number and subsequently, arrested the accused persons.

207.title: Assamese drug peddler held in K'taka's Madikeri, drugs worth ₹50,000 seized
207.article_body: Police in Karnataka's Kodagu district on Wednesday arrested an Assamese man for selling marijuana and seized drugs worth ₹50,000 from him. "Madikeri Rural Police has arrested an Assamese man...at...Chettalli village under Madikeri rural police station," Kodagu SP tweeted. This comes after the district police busted a drug peddling racket on Tuesday and seized drugs worth ₹10 lakh.

208.title: Jharkhand ruling alliance delegation meets Governor amid CM disqualification row
208.article_body: Amid the row of Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren's disqualification as an MLA, the ruling Jharkhand Mukti Morcha-Congress alliance delegation on Thursday met Governor Ramesh Bais. This comes after the Election Commission reportedly recommended the disqualification of the CM to the Governor. Soren is accused of violating electoral law by extending a mining lease to himself.

209.title: We asked reason, there was no bitterness: Cong's Hooda on Azad’s resignation
209.article_body: Congress' Bhupinder Singh Hooda, while speaking about a meeting held earlier with Ghulam Nabi Azad, said, "Party presidential polls are taking place. Still, he decided to quit. We asked him reason...there was no bitterness." Furthermore, he said, "We had been in same party for years and we had put forth some demands. Those demands were accepted."

210.title: Delhi court acquits man, his parents in dowry death case, says 'taunting not cruelty'
210.article_body: A Delhi court has acquitted a man and his parents in a dowry death case, saying that "the usual acts of taunting within the fabric of a family do not become cruelty". They were accused of subjecting the woman to cruelty that prompted her to die by suicide. The court said the testimony of the deceased's mother was "shaky".

211.title: Working with Ranbir, Big B in 'Brahmastra' was dream come true: Soni
211.article_body: Actor Markand Soni said working with actors Ranbir Kapoor and Amitabh Bachchan was a "100%" dream come true. "I've never met someone as kind and as sweet as Ranbir Kapoor and Amitabh Bachchan sir," he added. Soni further called them grounded. '''Brahmastra' is going to be like something you have never seen before in the Hindi film industry," he added.

212.title: Films with bad scripts get rejected, I'm one of the victims: Chiranjeevi
212.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi said the number of people coming to theatres has gone down after the pandemic. However, he added people will come if the film's script is good. "The bad films get rejected on the second day of their release. I'm one of the victims of this trend," he added. Chiranjeevi's 'Acharya' failed to perform at the box office.

213.title: HS Prannoy defeats ex-world champion to enter Japan Open quarterfinals
213.article_body: Shuttler HS Prannoy has entered the quarterfinals of the ongoing Japan Open Super 750 tournament after defeating 2021 men's singles world champion Loh Kean Yew of Singapore. Prannoy won with a scoreline of 22-20, 21-19 in a 44-minute second-round match. The 30-year-old Indian will next face Chinese Taipei's Chou Tien Chen in the last-eight stage.

214.title: Water in all Bengaluru lakes unfit for drinking: KSPCB report
214.article_body: According to a water quality analysis report by Karnataka State Pollution Control Board (KSPCB), out of the 105 lakes in Bengaluru, not a single lake is fit to be a drinking water source. Entry of untreated sewage and industrial effluents into them remain the major reasons behind the contamination of these water bodies, the report said.

215.title: Thane teen beaten up for not bringing crowd to Ganpati procession
215.article_body: An 18-year-old boy from Thane was allegedly beaten up by four persons for failing to gather a crowd for Ganpati procession, a police officer said on Thursday. According to police, the boy had promised he would get people for a welcome procession but stopped taking calls as the festival arrived. So, the accused went to his house and assaulted him.

216.title: Did KCR travel to Patna to get insulted?: Amit Malviya on Nitish Kumar, KCR video
216.article_body: Following a viral clip of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao, BJP’s Amit Malviya said, "Did KCR travel to Patna to get insulted like this?" In the video, Kumar was seen getting up to leave when Rao is asked if he'll back Kumar as PM candidate. Rao is seen holding Kumar and requesting him to sit.

217.title: Man shoots biker for talking on phone outside his house in Noida
217.article_body: A 40-year-old man was reportedly shot at after he stopped his motorcycle to take a phone call outside a house in Noida. The house owner, identified as Amit Bhati, had allegedly objected to the biker talking on the phone outside his house and subsequently, he shot him from his balcony. The victim sustained bullet injury, while the accused is absconding.

218.title: Man jumps in front of train at Delhi's Tilak Nagar metro station, dies
218.article_body: A man died allegedly after jumping in front of a moving train at Delhi Metro's Tilak Nagar station on Thursday, police said. The man was taken to a hospital where he was declared brought dead, police added. "Delay in services between Dwarka Sector 21 and Noida Electronic City/Vaishali due to a passenger on track at Tilak Nagar," DMRC tweeted.

219.title: Markets end in red with Sensex falling 770 points, Nifty at 17,542
219.article_body: The benchmark indices ended in the red on Thursday with Sensex falling 770.48 points to 58,766.59. Nifty ended 216.5 points lower at 17,542.80 dragged by IT, metal, power and oil and gas stocks. Hindalco Industries, Reliance Industries, ONGC and TCS were among the top Nifty losers, while stocks of Tata Consumer Products, Bajaj Finserv, Asian Paints and Eicher Motors gained.

220.title: Amitabh Bachchan tests negative for COVID-19, resumes 'KBC 14' shoot
220.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan said he has tested negative for COVID-19 and is "back at work". He also expressed his gratitude to his fans for their prayers and concern. A source informed Indian Express that Amitabh has resumed 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14' shoot, and this time, the reality show's producers have made COVID-19 safety protocols "a little stricter" on sets.

221.title: Alia Bhatt's work drives me, inspires me to do better: Kriti Sanon
221.article_body: Responding to a question by Karan Johar over her thoughts on actress Alia Bhatt being the best actress currently, actress Kriti Sanon said, "[Alia's work] drives me." "It inspires me to do better when I see great work. I would love to have an opportunity like 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'," she added. Recently, Kriti won Best Actress at Filmfare Awards for 'Mimi'.

222.title: I want Kohli at his best, but just make sure he doesn't score vs Aus: Ponting
222.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said he wants to see Virat Kohli among the leading run scorers in the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "But just make sure he doesn't score many runs against Australia," Ponting added jokingly. "The fact that Kohli [took] that month off...to get himself back...There're a lot of good signs there," he further said.

223.title: Maha Metro gets funding approval for extension of Pune Metro project
223.article_body: Maha Metro has received in-principle approval from the European Investment Bank (EIB) for funding the extension of the Pune Metro project. A Maha Metro official said the EIB would be contributing around 60% of the Pune Metro Phase I project cost. The 5.464-km extension of the Swargate-Katraj will cost ₹3,600 crore, while the PCMC-Nigdi extension line will cost ₹911 crore.

224.title: US orders Nvidia, AMD to halt sales of top AI chips to China
224.article_body: Nvidia and AMD have been ordered by US officials to stop selling some of their high-performance chips to China that can be used for artificial intelligence (AI). This would affect export of Nvidia's A100 and H100 chips and AMD's MI250 chips to China. The restrictions would also cost Nvidia up to $400 million (nearly ₹3,181.5 crore) in potential sales.

225.title: BPSC prelims to be held on one day and in one shift as before: Bihar govt after protests
225.article_body: Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) 67th Combined (Preliminary) Competitive Examination (CCE) will be held on one day and in one shift as before, the state government said on Thursday. This comes after protests by candidates against the exam schedule. Bihar CM Nitish Kumar had called for a meeting with the Chief Secretary and other office bearers following the protests.

226.title: Punjabi singer Nirvair Singh dies in road accident in Australia
226.article_body: Punjabi singer Nirvair Singh was killed in a crash in Australia on Tuesday, according to 9News. The father-of-two was caught in a three-vehicle collision near Melbourne caused by a speeding Kia sedan, the outlet further said quoting the police. The 23-year-old driver of the sedan has been arrested and charged. Singh, 42, was on his way to a job site.

227.title: Considering to establish a longer-term presence at Zaporizhzhia plant: IAEA
227.article_body: Director-general of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), Rafael Grossi, said that his team is considering to establish a longer-term presence at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant site. Grossi added that there has been increased shelling at the site but the IAEA team will not stop. Russia accused Ukrainian troops of launching an operation for provocation to disrupt the visit.

228.title: Dasun said we have 2 world-class bowlers, I don't see any in SL: B'desh Team Director
228.article_body: Bangladesh Team Director Khaled Mahmud has reacted to Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka's remark that Bangladesh have "only two world-class bowlers" in their team. Khaled said, "I don't see any in Sri Lanka, at least Bangladesh have two. That's very good." Dasun made the remark after losing against Afghanistan, claiming that Bangladesh would be an "easier opponent" in Asia Cup.

229.title: BJP MLAs demand Sisodia's resignation, burn Kejriwal's effigy in Delhi
229.article_body: After three BJP MLAs were marshalled out of the Delhi Assembly on Thursday following an argument with Deputy Speaker Rakhi Birla, the party workers staged protest outside the Assembly. They demanded Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's resignation over excise and classroom scam allegations. They also burnt an effigy of CM Arvind Kejriwal and chanted slogans of 'Manish Sisodia chor hai'.

230.title: BEST adds 3 more overnight bus services in Mumbai
230.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) announced three more overnight bus services from South Bombay to Oshiwara, Vikhroli and Shivaji Nagar. The buses will operate from sometime close to midnight up to 6 am, an official said. These new services are an addition to the 25 special services for South Mumbai and Central Mumbai travellers.

231.title: N Korea likely to send workers to Russia-backed regions of East Ukraine
231.article_body: North Korea has hinted at its interest in sending construction workers to help rebuild Russia-occupied territories in eastern Ukraine. North Korean ambassador to Moscow met envoys from two Russia-backed territories in Donbas and expressed optimism over cooperation in the "field of labour migration". In July, North Korea recognised independence of Donetsk and Luhansk in Ukraine.

232.title: If you get hit by HK, it won't let you sleep: Reetinder on Avesh, Arshdeep
232.article_body: Discussing the performance of Team India pacers Avesh Khan and Arshdeep Singh against Hong Kong, ex-India all-rounder Reetinder Singh Sodhi said, "If you get hit by Hong Kong, then it won't let you sleep that night." "Arshdeep was missing the radar and Avesh was expensive," added Reetinder. Arshdeep conceded 44 runs against Hong Kong with Avesh giving away 53 runs.

233.title: Hope to get justice: Ex-Bihar minister Kartikeya Singh after resigning
233.article_body: Former Bihar minister Kartikeya Singh, who resigned from his post amid protests, said, "BJP couldn't tolerate a minister from Bhumihars community." Singh, who is accused in kidnapping of a builder in 2014, added, "They want to tarnish my image…I trust the judiciary and hope to get justice. I resigned because all of it was tarnishing the image of our government."

234.title: German defence chief warns West against underestimating Russian forces
234.article_body: Germany's Chief of Defence has warned that western countries must not underestimate Russian land forces' potential to open a second theatre of war. General Eberhard Zorn added that most of the Russian navy has not yet been deployed in the war on Ukraine, and the Russian air force still has significant potential...which poses a threat to NATO too.

235.title: Tech can help solve some of India's biggest challenges: Microsoft Prez
235.article_body: Microsoft President Brad Smith on Thursday said technology can help solve some of India's biggest challenges like climate change and food security. "I'm in India as the country celebrates 75 years of Independence. It's an exciting time to learn more about...how India's innovation is shaping future," Smith said. He'd earlier said India will become the global superpower in artificial intelligence.

236.title: NIA announces ₹25 lakh reward on underworld don Dawood Ibrahim
236.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has announced a cash reward of ₹25 lakh for any information leading to the arrest of underworld don Dawood Ibrahim, an official said. It has also announced a reward of ₹20 lakh on Ibrahim's aide Shakeel Shaikh (Chhota Shakeel) and ₹15 lakh on Tiger Memon. Earlier, the NIA registered a case against Dawood's gang 'D-Company'.

237.title: Police seize banned gutkha worth ₹88 lakh in Mumbai, 2 arrested
237.article_body: Mumbai Police's Crime Branch seized banned gutkha worth ₹88 lakh in Goregaon and arrested two persons, an official said. The value of the seizure is ₹1 crore, including the cost of the vehicle used for transportation. The accused had loaded the consignment in their vehicle in Karnataka which was meant for delivery at various places in Mumbai, the official added.

238.title: China denounces UN report on abuse of Uyghur Muslims in Xinjiang
238.article_body: China has denounced the United Nations' report on arbitrary detention of Uyghurs, saying that the UN rights office is "thug and accomplice of the US and the West". China's diplomatic mission in Geneva said that the report ignores human rights achievements made in Xinjiang. The report pointed out that China committed serious human rights violations under anti-terrorism and anti-extremism policies.

239.title: 1st feedback of Dil Se was bad, exhibitors felt killing SRK was mistake: RGV
239.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma has revealed the immediate feedback of the 1998 film 'Dil Se..' was negative. "The exhibitors felt that killing Shah Rukh Khan was a mistake. They told us that due to the tragic ending, the viewers are giving the film thumbs down," he added. Varma, who was one of the film's producers, stated they were all panicking.

240.title: 5 men assault youth, chop off his hair in UP's Hardoi; video surfaces
240.article_body: Police have arrested five persons for allegedly beating a youth and chopping his hair off in UP's Hardoi after the incident's video went viral on social media. The victim, Rohit, was assaulted after some women complained that he was following them while he was wandering in Kaithi Purwa village. Accused were arrested after police took cognisance of the video.

241.title: KL Rahul probably has 'more ability' than Rohit Sharma: Gautam Gambhir
241.article_body: Discussing Team India opener KL Rahul's 36 off 39 balls in the Asia Cup match against Hong Kong, Gautam Gambhir said, "Rahul has so much ability...Only he can stop himself if he doesn't play freely." "I won't hesitate to say that...he probably has more ability than Rohit Sharma...He's shown that by doing it in international cricket," added Gambhir.

242.title: It's not survey but mini NRC: Owaisi on survey of UP madrassas
242.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised the UP government's decision to conduct a survey of unrecognised madrassas in the state. "It's not a survey but a mini NRC. Some madrassas are under UP madrassa board," Owaisi said. "Government can't interfere with our rights under Article 30. They want to harass Muslims," he added.

243.title: In 2003 too Mamata had called RSS 'patriots': Asaduddin Owaisi
243.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi reacted to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's remark that there are many "good people" in RSS who "don't support BJP" and said, "In 2003 too Mamata had called RSS patriots." "RSS wants Hindu Rashtra...She'd defended BJP government in Parliament after Gujarat pogrom. Hope TMC's Muslim faces praise her for her honesty and consistency," Owaisi added.

244.title: Customs officials seize gold worth over ₹22 lakh at Bengaluru airport
244.article_body: Customs officials seized gold worth over ₹22 lakh from a passenger at Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru on Tuesday. The passenger had arrived from Bangkok. He was trying to smuggle gold in the form of a paste and had concealed it in his rectum, Bengaluru Customs tweeted. After extraction, gold weighing 442.34 grams was seized from him, officials added.

245.title: Inmate sends obscene letters to girl from Yerawada jail, booked
245.article_body: Police have booked an inmate at Yerawada jail for stalking a 17-year-old girl by sending her obscene letters from prison, said police officials on Wednesday. "Prima facie it seems that, [the accused] was stalking and creating terror in her mind from jail by sending letters," Police sub-inspector S Shimpane said. Two cases have already been registered against him earlier.

246.title: Man who shot 16-year-old girl after she stopped talking to him arrested in Delhi
246.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested a 19-year-old man named Amanat Ali for shooting and injuring a 16-year-old schoolgirl in South Delhi on August 25. Police said Ali had allegedly tried to kill the girl, who was his social media acquaintance, as he was angry that she had stopped talking to him. His associates Bobby (24) and Pawan (19) were arrested earlier.

247.title: 1 killed, 2 injured as gas cylinder explodes in Hyderabad
247.article_body: One person was killed and two others were injured after a gas cylinder exploded in a house on Thursday in Hyderabad's Lingampalli. Police said the incident occurred in the house of Ambala Naik, an immigrant from Rajasthan. "They have a small operation of making ice cream and badam milk in their house," police said, adding Naik died on the spot.

248.title: Property registrations in Mumbai see 20% annual rise in Aug: Report
248.article_body: Property registrations in Mumbai saw an annual rise of 20% in August, as per data published by Knight Frank India. The city reportedly witnessed property sale registrations of 8,149 units during the month, contributing over ₹620 crore to the state revenues. "August 2022 was the best performing August month in the last 10 years," Knight Frank India said.

249.title: August GST revenue collection jumps 28% YoY at ₹1.44 lakh crore
249.article_body: The Goods and Services Tax (GST) revenue increased by 28% to ₹1,43,612 crore in August as against ₹1,12,020 crore in the corresponding month last year, the Finance Ministry said. GST revenue crossed the ₹1.40 lakh crore mark for the sixth consecutive month led by robust economic recovery and compliance, the ministry added. The growth till August 2022 is 33% y-o-y.

250.title: Attacks on Muslims rising in Assam due to upcoming 2024 LS polls: AIUDF chief
250.article_body: Attacks on Islamic religious schools and Muslims in Assam are rising as 2024 Lok Sabha elections are approaching, AIUDF President Badruddin Ajmal said. This comes after state authorities demolished a madrasa in Assam's Bongaigaon which was allegedly being used for terror activities. Ajmal said demolitions were being done to intimidate Muslims and make them vote for BJP out of fear.

251.title: Chairman of Russia's 2nd largest oil firm dies after fall from hospital window: Reports
251.article_body: The chairman of Russia's second-largest oil producer Lukoil died on Thursday after falling from a hospital window, as per reports. Ravil Maganov, 67, was being treated at the city's Central Clinical Hospital and died from his injuries, reported Russian media. Maganov is the second top executive at Lukoil to die under mysterious circumstances in recent months.

252.title: Share prices of fuel exporters fall after windfall profit tax hike
252.article_body: After the Centre increased the windfall profit tax on the export of diesel and aviation turbine fuel, the shares of Indian fuel exporters dropped up to 3% in the morning trade on Thursday. ONGC declined by 2.2%, Reliance Industries Limited fell by 1.5%, Chennai Petroleum Corporation Limited by 3.3%, Mangalore Refinery & Petrochemicals by 1.5% and Oil India dropped 0.5%.

253.title: Tried to do matchmaking at party, asked Shanaya to speak to Tiger: Johar
253.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said he tried to engage in "matchmaking" during one of his parties by asking actor Sanjay Kapoor's daughter Shanaya Kapoor to speak to actor Tiger Shroff. "After ten minutes, Shanaya came...and said, 'I think he's really bored of me'," added Johar. Tiger responded by stating that he's feeling very ''bad", adding he thought he was being cool.

254.title: At this stage of my life, I don't have to work for stardom or money: Nagarjuna
254.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna has said that he wants to keep working till he can. "At this stage of my life, I don't have to work for stardom or money...except job satisfaction," he stated. Nagarjuna added, "My father literally died with his boots on. He collapsed on the set of a film. For an actor what can be better than that?"

255.title: Hong Kong not the right opposition to judge Virat Kohli: Gambhir
255.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said Hong Kong are not the right opposition to judge whether Virat Kohli is back in "rhythm". He added, "I hope Kohli will be seen in better rhythm in upcoming matches because it was not that sort of quality bowling." Kohli scored unbeaten 59 runs off 44 balls in the match.

256.title: Baby born with horn-like structure instead of legs in MP, pic surfaces
256.article_body: A baby was born without any legs in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpur district on August 26. Instead, the baby had a horn-like structure that protruded from below his torso. The baby was reportedly underdeveloped and weighed only 1 kg and 400 grams. The newborn has been admitted to the Shivpuri District Hospital where he is currently kept under supervision.

257.title: Simply can't fathom this approach: Venkatesh Prasad on KL Rahul's 36(39) vs Hong Kong
257.article_body: Reacting to KL Rahul's 39-ball 36-run knock against Hong Kong, former India fast bowler Venkatesh Prasad tweeted, "Is there something in the pitch that is not visible?" He added, "Simply can't fathom this approach especially from KL Rahul." India scored 70 runs in their first 10 overs against Hong Kong, but went on to put up a total of 192/2.

258.title: I wouldn't date Kartik Aaryan as I know him 'too well': Kriti Sanon
258.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said one of the reasons why she wouldn't date actor Kartik Aaryan is because she knows him "too well". Kriti added that a reason why she'd date Kartik is because she knows him well. Talking about actor Tiger Shroff, Kriti stated that one of the reasons she wouldn't date the actor is because he "flips too much".

259.title: 2023 Bengal panchayat polls will be 'grand affair': TMC's Anubrata Mondal
259.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Anubrata Mondal, who was arrested by CBI in connection with an alleged cattle smuggling case, said the panchayat election next year will be a "grand affair". "TMC supporters should work hard to ensure the party's victory," Mondal told reporters while being brought to Kolkata from Asansol. He was sent to 14-day judicial custody last week.

260.title: MBBS student found dead in her room at Delhi’s Safdarjung Hospital
260.article_body: A 22-year-old final year MBBS student was found dead in her room at New Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital on Thursday morning. Police recovered a note in her diary that stated she was under depression. They also found two empty packets of anti-depressants in her room. "Statements of...[her] friends...were recorded, and no foul play has been found so far," police said.

261.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook pledges support to Pak amid floods; Malala thanks him
261.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook has announced support for Pakistan amid the devastating floods. "Apple will donate to relief and recovery efforts on the ground," he said. Activist Malala Yousafzai thanked the Apple CEO for "providing support to Pakistan in this very difficult time". One-third of Pakistan has been completely submerged by historic flooding, which has killed at least 1,191 people.

262.title: KCR didn't even accept Nitish as a PM candidate: Sushil Modi
262.article_body: BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao didn't even accept Nitish Kumar as a Prime Minister candidate. His reaction came after a press conference video went viral in which Rao was questioned by a journalist whether he will back Nitish Kumar as the PM candidate. To this Rao responded, "Who am I to decide."

263.title: Moody's cuts India's growth forecast to 7.7% from 8.8% for 2022
263.article_body: Global credit rating agency Moody's Investors Service cut India's economic growth projection to 7.7% for 2022 from its May projection of 8.8%. It said that the economic momentum will slow down on a sequential basis owing to rising interest rates, uneven monsoon and slowing global growth. However, the rating agency said the services and manufacturing sectors have seen robust upswings.

264.title: Delhi Assembly passes motion of confidence tabled by CM Arvind Kejriwal
264.article_body: Delhi Assembly on Thursday passed the motion of confidence moved by CM Arvind Kejriwal through a voice vote as well as division of votes. Fifty-eight MLAs voted in favour and none voted against it as BJP MLAs were not present in Assembly. The motion was brought amid allegations by the AAP that the BJP was trying to topple its government.

265.title: Meta plans to create more paid features for Instagram, Facebook
265.article_body: Meta is setting up a new group to create more paid products and features for Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp. "Any new product will be complementary to our existing ads business," a Meta spokesperson told Reuters on Wednesday. The group, named New Monetization Experiences, will be reportedly led by the company's former head of research Pratiti Raychoudhury.

266.title: PM Modi is strong personality yet sensitive at heart: Film producer Jain
266.article_body: Film producer Mahaveer Jain said that he was "very fortunate" to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Speaking about PM Modi, Mahaveer said, "He is a very strong personality yet very sensitive and emotional at heart." Jain further added, "He himself is a very creative person who admires the creative fraternity for its positive contribution."

267.title: April-July fiscal deficit at ₹3.40 lakh crore, 20.5% of FY23 target
267.article_body: The Centre's fiscal deficit was 20.5% of the annual target in July end as against 21.3% in the year-ago period, the Controller General of Accounts data showed. The fiscal deficit was ₹3.40 lakh crore during the April-July period in actual terms. For the full FY23, the fiscal deficit is pegged at ₹16.6 lakh crore or 6.4% of the GDP.

268.title: Expecting too much too soon will create problems: Karim on Rahul, Virat's batting
268.article_body: Referring to KL Rahul and Virat Kohli's innings against Hong Kong, former India cricketer Saba Karim has said India could've scored 15-20 more runs in the match but the team needs to "nurture" the experienced players once they come back after a break. "If you expect too much too soon, it will create problems for your own team," added Karim

269.title: Taiwan looks forward to producing 'democracy chips' with US: Prez
269.article_body: Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen told the governor of the US state of Arizona, Doug Ducey, that the island nation is looking forward to producing "democracy chips" with the US. Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd (TSMC) is constructing a $12 billion plant in Arizona. Ducey told Tsai that partnership with Taiwan was "the greatest" in the semiconductor industry.

270.title: RSS wasn't that bad before, many people in RSS don't support BJP: Mamata
270.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday said that RSS wasn't that bad earlier. "I don't think they (RSS) are that bad. Still, there are many good people in RSS and they don't support BJP. They will also break their silence one day," she added. Removing BJP from Centre would be my last fight, Mamata had said on Monday.

271.title: IMF provisionally agrees to give crisis-hit Sri Lanka $2.9-bn loan
271.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Thursday said that it has provisionally agreed to give a loan of about $2.9 billion to Sri Lanka which is grappling with an economic crisis. IMF and Sri Lanka have entered a 48-month-long arrangement under the former's Extended Fund Facility. The agreement is subject to approval by the IMF management and its Executive Board.

272.title: AAP has just been born but 169 cases against 49 MLAs so far: Kejriwal
272.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has "just been born" but there have been 169 cases against 49 party MLAs so far. "Of these, 134 (cases) have been closed," he added in the Delhi Assembly. The investigation agencies have not been able to prove any of the BJP's corruption allegations, Kejriwal further said.

273.title: Aamir Khan Productions posts apology video, says 'Hum sab insane hai'; later deletes it
273.article_body: An apology video, now deleted, was posted on the social media pages of Aamir Khan Productions on Thursday during the Jain festival of Samvatsari. Starting with 'Micchami Dukkadam', it carried typos with a Hindi voiceover and said, "Hum sab insane hai…Aur galtiyan humse...hoti hai." It further said that if I've ever hurt your feelings, then I ask for forgiveness.

274.title: Chinese city of Shenzhen expands COVID rules as cases rise
274.article_body: The Chinese city of Shenzhen tightened COVID restrictions on Thursday as cases continued to rise. Authorities have suspended large events and indoor entertainment for three days in Bao'an, the city's most populous district. Officials have urged residents not to leave the city unless urgent and those who must leave have to show proof of two negative tests within 48 hours.

275.title: After dispute, man texts colleagues saying he's ending his life; found dead in Gurugram
275.article_body: An employee at a multinational firm in Gurugram has allegedly died by suicide as he was upset with some of his colleagues, police said on Wednesday. His wife said she got a call from his company, informing her that a dispute took place in office and her husband has sent a message saying he was going to end his life.

276.title: 90-yr-old man gets 3-yr jail for sexually assaulting minor girl in Kerala
276.article_body: A Kerala court sentenced a 90-year-old man to three years in jail for sexually assaulting a minor girl in the Palakkad district of the state. The case pertained to 2020 when the accused assaulted the 15-year-old girl, who was his neighbour. According to the Special Public Prosecutor, the court found the accused guilty after examining nine witnesses and several documents.

277.title: IMF to provide Sri Lanka with $2.9 billion amid economic crisis
277.article_body: The International Monetary Fund will provide $2.9 billion to Sri Lanka over a period of four years under a preliminary agreement. In a statement, IMF team visiting Sri Lanka said that the arrangement will work to restore financial, macroeconomic stability, debt sustainability and unlock the country's growth potential. Sri Lanka is facing shortage of essential goods like fuel and medicines.

278.title: Differently-abled child found dead in Delhi, juvenile domestic help held
278.article_body: A juvenile domestic help was apprehended for allegedly murdering a differently-abled child in southwest Delhi, police said. The help was hired to take care of the child, police added. The accused also allegedly stole jewellery, a mobile phone and ₹40,000. The deceased's parents had gone to a temple and his sister had gone to a market during the incident.

279.title: Neither KCR nor Nitish Kumar will be CM by 2024: Sushil Modi
279.article_body: Former Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Modi said neither CM Nitish Kumar nor his Telangana counterpart K Chandrashekar Rao will be CM of their respective states by 2024. "Those whose own seats aren't safe are dreaming about becoming PM," Sushil Modi added. "KCR should better save his own CM seat in Telangana in 2023 polls," he stated.

280.title: Unemployment rate fell to 7.6% during Apr-June in urban areas: NSO
280.article_body: The unemployment rate for people in the age group of 15 years and above in urban areas dropped to 7.6% during April-June 2022 from 12.6% in the corresponding period last year, the National Statistical Office (NSO) said. This was led by an improved labour force participation ratio, pointing towards a sustained economic recovery after the COVID-19 pandemic.

281.title: SpiceJet CFO resigns after airline's Q1 net loss widens to ₹789 cr
281.article_body: SpiceJet's Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Sanjeev Taneja resigned from his post amid the airline reporting a widening of net loss to ₹789 crore during the April-June quarter, on Wednesday. The loss in the corresponding period last fiscal was ₹729 crore. SpiceJet said that its Board has identified a candidate for Taneja's replacement and the vacancy would be filled in September.

282.title: PMPML to run over 800 additional buses for Ganpati festival
282.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) will run extra buses for residents in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad areas during the Ganesh festival. While 168 additional buses will ply on September 1, 2 and 8, for September 3, 7 and 9, 654 more buses will be seen on roads. The public transport utility will also provide special night bus service.

283.title: World no. 1 Medvedev moves into US Open 3rd round with straight-sets win
283.article_body: Defending champion and world number one Daniil Medvedev entered the third round of the ongoing US Open 2022 after defeating Frenchman Arthur Rinderknech in straight sets. Medvedev won with a scoreline of 6-2, 7-5, 6-3 in two hours and 11 minutes. "In general, I'm happy with my level in the third set, so that's great," said Medvedev after the match.

284.title: Google workers protest outside US offices against $1.2 bn Israeli deal
284.article_body: Former and current Google employees protested outside its offices in San Francisco and called for it to end Project Nimbus, a $1.2 billion contract with Israel which includes Amazon as well. An employee said workers went public after their concerns were met with silence internally. Additional demonstrations are planned on September 8 in New York, Bay Area and Seattle.

285.title: Nitish Kumar stands up to leave presser on PM candidate's question, KCR holds him
285.article_body: A clip of a press conference of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has gone viral. Kumar is seen getting up to leave when Rao is asked if he will back Kumar as the PM candidate and his views on Rahul Gandhi's candidature as PM. Rao is then seen holding Kumar and requesting him to sit.

286.title: Tiger says Rekha played Big B's mother & love interest in films, Karan reacts
286.article_body: During the quiz round in the 'Koffee With Karan 7' episode featuring Kriti Sanon and Tiger Shroff, Karan Johar asked them to name the actress who played both Amitabh Bachchan's mother and love interest in films. Tiger replied, "Rekha ma'am?" Reacting to this, Karan said, "What? She never...played his mother." Karan revealed the actresses were Waheeda Rehman and Rakhee.

287.title: AAP calls Pune's VIP toilet plan unnecessary; PMC says much needed
287.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) criticised Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) plan to build 15 VIP public toilets across the city at a cost of over ₹36 lakh. "Small toilets should be constructed instead of costly and more seat blocks...The existing toilet system should be improved," AAP said. However, PMC said that the city badly required clean and well-managed toilets.

288.title: Man kills 35-year-old inmate at Pune rehab centre over toilet issue
288.article_body: A 35-year-old man was allegedly killed by a fellow inmate at a rehab centre in Pune's Dhayari, police said. The accused quarrelled with the victim over a toilet issue on Wednesday morning, police added. They had arguments while standing in a queue and the accused killed the victim by tying a towel around his neck inside the toilet, police stated.

289.title: Automobile offender arrested in Hyd, vehicles worth ₹12 lakh seized
289.article_body: Hyderabad's Medipally Police on Tuesday arrested an automobile offender and seized one car, six two-wheelers and gold and silver ornaments, all worth over ₹12 lakh from him. The accused, identified as Bharath Kumar Reddy, is a resident of Manikonda, police said. Notably, police verified over 180 CCTV cameras to track the stolen four-wheeler leading to Reddy's arrest, Rachakonda Police said.

290.title: 3 illegal colonies demolished in Gurugram: Officials
290.article_body: Gurugram authorities carried out a drive on Wednesday and demolished three illegal colonies in Farrukhnagar, Mubarikpur and Taj Nagar, officials said. The team used a JCB machine to demolish the illegal constructions and boundary walls of four plots among other structures, they added. The drive against illegal construction will continue, District Town Planner (Enforcement) Amit Madholia said.

291.title: Liquor should be diluted, consumed at specific time, says Chhattisgarh minister
291.article_body: Chhattisgarh minister Premsai Singh Tekam, while speaking at a de-addiction drive event, said alcohol should be diluted and consumed at a specific time. "There should be self-control. I once went to a meeting where they spoke for and against liquor. One side spoke of its benefits. Liquor should be diluted, there should be a duration (to consume it)," Tekam added.

292.title: SpiceJet shares fall nearly 15% after CFO resigns amid widening losses
292.article_body: SpiceJet shares declined nearly 15% during Thursday’s intraday trade to a one-month low after the airline reported widening of net loss to ₹789 crore in the June quarter. Notably, its CFO Sanjeev Taneja also resigned amid losses and a series of mid-air incidents. SpiceJet stock, which has fallen over 36% so far this year, was currently trading at ₹44.15.

293.title: I was depressed & heartbroken: Tiger Shroff on recent 'setback' in films
293.article_body: Talking about his reaction after his recent film didn't perform well, during his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', actor Tiger Shroff said, "I was heartbroken. I was depressed." "I'm just a very extreme person, I wouldn't say I sacrificed a lot because I like what I do," he further added. The actor's recent film 'Heropanti 2' failed to perform.

294.title: This is what I do best: Serena Williams after defeating world no. 2 in US Open
294.article_body: During her on-court interview after defeating world number two Anett Kontaveit in her US Open second-round match, Serena Williams said, "This is what I do best." She added, "I'm just Serena...I'm super competitive...I'm just looking at it as a bonus." The twenty three-time singles' Grand Slam champion had earlier stated she'll be "evolving away" from tennis following the US Open.

295.title: Days after girl set on fire by stalker dies, half-burnt body of woman found in Dumka
295.article_body: A woman's half-burnt body was found near Pahadpur village in the Taljhari Police Station area in Jharkhand's Dumka on Wednesday, police said. The victim's identity could not be established as the body was burnt beyond recognition, an official said. This comes days after a Class 12 girl died after she was set on fire by her alleged stalker in Dumka.

296.title: 18 years ago you chose to give up your high heels for me: Rishi Sunak to wife Akshata
296.article_body: UK PM candidate Rishi Sunak told wife Akshata Murthy at a campaigning event, "I'm incredibly grateful that 18 years ago you chose to give up your high heels and take a chance on the short kid with a backpack." Conservative Party members will pick the UK's next Prime Minister. The winner is set to be announced on Monday.

297.title: I was hanging by a thread: Kyrgios on his 2nd round win vs Bonzi in US Open
297.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios has entered the third round of the ongoing US Open 2022 after defeating Frenchman Benjamin Bonzi 7-6(7-3), 6-4, 4-6, 6-4. "I was hanging by a thread. His level today was incredible...I played some really risky tennis late in the fourth, which paid off," said Kyrgios. He'll now face American JJ Wolf in the third round.

298.title: Price of commercial LPG cylinders cut by up to ₹100; list of rates in cities released
298.article_body: State-owned fuel retailers on Thursday announced a reduction in the prices of commercial LPG cylinders. From today, a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder will be cheaper by ₹91.50 in Delhi and will be available for ₹1,885 instead of the earlier ₹1,976.50. Apart from Delhi, the prices have been reduced by up to ₹100 in Kolkata, Chennai and Mumbai.

299.title: Wanted my debut to be role which makes difference: Sargun on 'Cuttputlli'
299.article_body: Actress Sargun Mehta, who will be making her Bollywood debut with 'Cuttputlli', said, "I always wanted my debut to be a role which makes a difference to the story irrespective of the length." She added the subject of the film was "very interesting". Sargun stated, "I was getting an opportunity to work with Akshay Kumar, who is a brilliant actor."

300.title: West Bengal raises upper age limit for police recruitment to 30 years
300.article_body: West Bengal government on Wednesday decided to raise the upper age limit for recruitment of police constables from 27 years to 30 years, CM Mamata Banerjee said. Further, civic volunteers, village police, home guards and civil defence personnel will be eligible for promotion and relaxation will be given in upper age limit up to 35 years, Banerjee added.

301.title: PMC to build 15 VIP public toilets in Pune at the cost of ₹36 lakh
301.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has prepared a preliminary estimate of over ₹36 lakh to build 15 VIP public toilets across the city. Of the total cost, state government will share ₹25 lakh while PMC will have to spend ₹11 lakh. These toilets will have vending machines, paper napkins, sanitary napkins, and disposal machines along with shower and toilet facilities.

302.title: UP govt to conduct survey of unrecognised madrassas across state
302.article_body: UP government has announced to conduct a survey of unrecognised madrassas in the state to gather information about curriculum, the number of teachers and basic facilities available there, among others. Minister of State for Minority Welfare Danish Azad Ansari said details such as number of students studying there, facilities of drinking water, electricity supply and toilet will be collected.

303.title: Nitish calls for meeting after lathi-charge on protesting BPSC candidates
303.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has taken cognisance of the problem of the candidates regarding the examination of the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC), the CM's office said. He has called for a meeting with the Chief Secretary and other office bearers for its solution, it added. This comes following protests by candidates who were lathi-charged by the police in Patna.

304.title: Tesla tests SUVs under 50°C temperature in Dubai, shares pics
304.article_body: Tesla took to Instagram and Twitter to share pictures of its field quality engineers testing SUVs in Dubai. The company said the "extreme heat and durability testing" was conducted during hottest time of the year in Dubai when temperatures reach over 50°C. According to the pictures, Model X Plaid and Model Y were among the vehicles included in the test.

305.title: SpaceX launching Starlink satellites roughly every 5 days: Musk
305.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to note that the firm is launching Starlink satellites roughly every five days. This comes after SpaceX launched 46 Starlink satellites on Tuesday, completing its sixth launch this month. SpaceX has launched 39 missions this year and Musk has confirmed that it plans to launch 100 orbital missions in 2023.

306.title: Serena beats world no.2 Anett Kontaveit, enters 3rd round of US Open
306.article_body: Discussing her 7-6(4), 2-6, 6-2 win against second seed Anett Kontaveit to enter US Open's third round, Serena Williams said, "After losing the second set, I thought 'Oh, my goodness'." "I had to give my best...because 'this could be it'," Serena added. "I don't have anything to lose. I've had an X on my back since 1999," she stated.

307.title: Shame that considered such a frivolous man a leader: Khera to Azad
307.article_body: Congress leader Pawan Khera criticised former Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad over a television interview following his exit from the party where he mocked Rahul Gandhi's foreign trips. Sharing the video of Ghulam Nabi Azad's comment, Pawan Khera wrote on Twitter, "It is a matter of shame that such a frivolous man was considered a leader."

308.title: Oil tanker briefly blocks Suez Canal; freed after 5 hours
308.article_body: A 64,000-tonne oil tanker briefly blocked the traffic in Suez Canal after it ran aground on Wednesday. While it took around five hours to free Affinity V, a technical failure in the vessel's steering mechanism caused it to hit the bank of the canal. Earlier in March 2021, Japanese-owned Ever Given blocked the canal for six days before being released.

309.title: Centre hikes windfall profit tax on export of diesel, ATF
309.article_body: The government has increased the windfall profit tax on the export of diesel to ₹13.5 per litre from ₹7, while that on aviation turbine fuel exports to ₹9 per litre from ₹2. The tax on domestically-produced crude oil has also been hiked by ₹300 per tonne to ₹13,300. The prices come into effect from Thursday, a Finance Ministry notification said.

310.title: Flush from $250M Series-D, Rippling invests in B'luru talent: Rippling
310.article_body: On the heels of its $250M Series-D fundraising round, Rippling is doubling down on Bengaluru as an engineering hub, the company said, with a recruiting campaign aimed at attracting top engineering talent. It added that the campaign focuses on the level of ownership that engineers experience at Rippling compared to other top tech firms with a substantial presence in Bengaluru.

311.title: Are you saying Rahul should be dropped: Suryakumar to journalist asking if he'd open
311.article_body: After a journalist asked Suryakumar Yadav if he'd open with Rohit Sharma at some point in Asia Cup, Suryakumar Yadav jokingly replied, "Are you saying...KL Rahul should be dropped?" He added, "I'm really flexible to bat at any number. I've told coach and captain that they can play me at any number but I want to be in the team."

312.title: Many more wickets will fall now: Sushil Modi after Kartikeya Singh's resignation
312.article_body: After Bihar Minister Kartikeya Singh, who is accused in the kidnapping of a builder in 2014, resigned from his post amid protests, ex-Deputy CM Sushil Modi tweeted, "The first wicket has just fallen. Many more wickets will fall now." Furthermore, Sushil Modi said, "Nitish Kumar got clean bowled in the first over itself."

313.title: Nashik-bound SpiceJet flight returns to Delhi due to 'autopilot' snag
313.article_body: A Nashik-bound SpiceJet flight returned to Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport on Thursday morning due to an 'autopilot' snag the plane encountered midway, an official said. SpiceJet flight SG8363 took off from Delhi at 6:54am and returned after an hour of its departure time. The Boeing 737 aircraft landed safely and the passengers were shifted to a smaller Q400 aircraft.

314.title: Police add POCSO charges in Dumka girl's murder case after deceased found to be a minor
314.article_body: Police added sections of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012 (POCSO) in the Dumka girl's murder case in Jharkhand. This comes after the state Child Welfare Committee said the girl was a minor as per the Class 10 board examination mark sheet. The Class 12 girl died after she was set ablaze by a man named Shahrukh.

315.title: Ex-Punjab minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu sent to 14-day judicial custody
315.article_body: Former Punjab Food and Civil Supplies Minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu has been sent to judicial custody for 14 days in connection with the alleged food grains transportation tenders scam. Earlier, Ashu was sent to police custody till August 27 following his arrest from Ludhiana by Punjab Vigilance Bureau on August 22. The defence counsel called the case "false and frivolous".

316.title: Meta takes action against 2.7 cr Facebook, Instagram posts in India
316.article_body: Social media giant Meta had taken action against 2.5 crore posts on Facebook and 20 lakh posts on Instagram in July in India under the Information Technology Rules, 2021, it said. Action was taken against 1.73 crore spam content, 27 lakh posts related to "adult nudity and sexual activity" and 23 lakh "violent and graphic content" related content on Facebook.

317.title: 5 minor girls go missing from shelter home in Pune, search underway
317.article_body: Police have launched a search for five minor girls who went missing from Matoshree Ravma shelter home in Pune's Hadapsar. The incident came to light on Tuesday morning, reports said. According to police, the girls hail from Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Jalgaon, Buldhana and Thane. The shelter had identified their parents and was making arrangements to hand over the minors, police added.

318.title: Eligible police personnel to get houses at ₹15 lakh in redeveloped BDD chawls
318.article_body: The Maharashtra Housing Department issued a notification to give houses at ₹15 lakh in redeveloped Bombay Development Directorate (BDD) chawls to police personnel who were residing in BDD chawls till January 1, 2011. Earlier, the price for these houses was fixed at ₹50 lakh. The notification comes just five days after CM Eknath Shinde announced the same in the Assembly.

319.title: 'The Kapil...' is my show as well, I'll be back again: Krushna Abhishek
319.article_body: Actor-comedian Krushna Abhishek has said that 'The Kapil Sharma Show' is his show as well and revealed that he will be back again. Speaking about the rumours about the tension between him and Kapil Sharma, Krushna said, "There is no issue." This comes as Krushna had previously said he will not be featuring in the show due to "agreement issues".

320.title: Apple releases iOS 12.5.6 update for older iPhones with security fixes
320.article_body: Apple has released an iOS 12.5.6 update for older iPhone, iPod touch and iPad models that are not able to run iOS 13 or newer updates. The update fixes the WebKit vulnerability, which was already fixed in iOS 15.6.1 and iPadOS 15.6.1. It is available for iPhone 5s, iPhone 6, iPhone 6 Plus and iPad Air, among others.

321.title: India reports 7,946 new COVID-19 cases and 37 deaths
321.article_body: India has reported 7,946 new COVID-19 cases and 25 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Health Ministry. Additionally, 12 reconciled deaths from earlier period were added in Kerala. This comes a day after the country recorded 7,231 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country dropped to 62,748, while the daily positivity rate stood at 2.98%.

322.title: I wouldn't have agreed to have Pant instead of Hardik in the XI: Gambhir
322.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said he wouldn't have agreed to have Rishabh Pant instead of Hardik Pandya in the playing XI against Hong Kong. "If you're resting Hardik, then I think Deepak Hooda, who can bowl a couple of overs, deserves a go," he added. Gambhir, however, also stated that Rishabh should've played, but in place of Dinesh Karthik.

323.title: Yen drops to 24-year low to 139.59/dollar as Treasury yields rise
323.article_body: The yen fell to its lowest to 139.59 per dollar in Thursday’s trading recording a 24-year low as US Treasury yields surged through 3.2% owing to the Federal Reserve’s hawkish stance at the Jackson Hole symposium. During the 1998 Asian financial crisis, the yen had reached around 146 to the dollar. Japan had previously intervened at levels around 130.

324.title: SpiceJet makes payments in 'graded format', delays salaries for 2nd straight month
324.article_body: SpiceJet employees have alleged a delay in their salaries for the second consecutive month. Meanwhile, the airline said that the salaries will be credited in a "graded format". In an internal communication, mentioning the delay, SpiceJet said the "previous few months have been difficult" due to a "superlative fuel price hike" and also a "historically lean period of July-September".

325.title: I dream of buying a private jet, don't have to prove I'm relatable: Kartik
325.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has revealed that his dreams are getting bigger and said that his wishes of buying a Lamborghini and becoming an actor were fulfilled. Kartik was asked if he now dreams of buying a private jet. To this, he replied, "Private jet should also come...I don't have to prove that I come from Gwalior and that I'm relatable."

326.title: Before going to bat, I told Rohit that I'd try to take the tempo up: Suryakumar
326.article_body: Talking about his unbeaten 68*(26) against Hong Kong in Asia Cup, Suryakumar Yadav said, "Before I got out to bat, I spoke to Rohit...and told [him] I'd try to take the tempo up." Suryakumar came in to bat when India were 94/2 after 12.6 overs and added 98 runs with Virat Kohli. The 31-year-old smashed four sixes in final over.

327.title: Sensex falls 700 points, Nifty at 17,558 in opening trade
327.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in the red on Thursday with Sensex falling 707.39 points at 58,829.68 and Nifty down 200.80 points at 17,558.50. Infosys, SBI Life Insurance, TCS, Hindalco Industries, ONGC were among the major Nifty losers, while the shares of Bharti Airtel, Bajaj Auto, IndusInd Bank, Bajaj Finserv and UltraTech Cement gained. Nearly 1,101 shares advanced and 1,052 shares declined.

328.title: Noida Police sends ₹64 lakh bill to firm which carried twin towers' demolition
328.article_body: Noida Police has raised a bill of ₹64 lakh to Edifice Engineering, the firm that carried out Noida's Supertech twin towers demolition, for providing personnel as security escort when explosives were transported to the demolition site. During the process of preparation for demolition of the towers, explosives were transported daily from Haryana's Palwal, the police said.

329.title: Jacqueline deleted data on Sukesh from her phones to hamper investigation: ED
329.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate in its chargesheet has said that actress Jacqueline Fernandez "knowingly and deliberately deleted all the data" with respect to conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar from her phones with an aim to "hamper the investigation" to save herself and her family. She allegedly also requested her staff to delete data related to Sukesh from their phones.

330.title: Partha destroyed unemployed youth's dreams, should be punished severely: BJP leader
330.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said ex-West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee should be punished "severely". "A special trial should be conducted...under the influence of Mamata Banerjee, Chatterjee took a bribe of ₹800-1,000 crore...destroyed the dreams of unemployed youth," Adhikari added. A special court extended judicial custody of Chatterjee and his close aide Arpita Mukherjee till September 14.

331.title: Been single for 1.25 yrs: Kartik on if he lied about his relationship with Sara
331.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, during an interview, was asked if he lied about his relationship with Sara Ali Khan after Karan Johar confirmed his relationship on 'Koffee With Karan'. To this, he replied, "I've been single [for] the past 1.25 years, I don't know about anything else." Kartik and Sara were rumoured to be dating while filming 'Love Aaj Kal 2'.

332.title: Will fight SC order on Bengaluru Idgah Maidan: Karnataka Minister
332.article_body: The Idgah Maidan in Bengaluru's Chamarajpet is a "public property" and the legal fight over its ownership will continue in courts, said Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka. His remarks came after the Supreme Court on Tuesday denied permission for celebrating Ganesh Chaturthi on the ground and ordered status quo. "People...were eager to celebrate Ganesh Chaturthi at the ground," he added.

333.title: Punjab bans sarpanch proxies; bars elected women's male relatives from meetings
333.article_body: Punjab government has banned proxies for women heading panchayats in the state. Husbands or relatives of elected women will not be allowed in any meeting, it added. "I have been getting reports that most of the women sarpanches don't attend meetings...What is the purpose of reservation for women if this happens?" Rural Development and Panchayats Minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal said.

334.title: China's detention of Uyghurs in Xinjiang may constitute crimes against humanity: UN
334.article_body: China's "discriminatory detention" of Uyghurs and other Muslims in Xinjiang region may constitute crimes against humanity, the outgoing UN human rights chief has said in a report. The report added that "serious human rights violations have been committed" in Xinjiang "in the context of the Government's application of counter-terrorism and counter-'extremism' strategies''.

335.title: Short of words to describe Suryakumar Yadav's innings: Rohit Sharma
335.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma said "words will be short" to describe Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 68-run innings against Hong Kong in their Asia Cup match on Wednesday. "We've seen that with Suryakumar every now and then. He comes up with [such] kinds of knocks. He just comes out and bats fearlessly which is what the team expects from him," added Rohit.

336.title: BJP govt turned probe agencies into political instruments: Tejashwi
336.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said the BJP government at the Centre has turned investigative agencies into instruments for "political revenge" in the past eight years. "Our opposition to the CBI now is not against the institution but their politically motivated mode of operation...We were never against...officers of these agencies. We know that they are just following orders," Yadav added.

337.title: Mob of commuters manhandle station master in Thane after train delay
337.article_body: A mob of commuters manhandled a station master as MEMU trains were running behind schedule on Mumbai's Vasai Road-Diva railway route, the Railway Police said. The angry commuters staged a protest at Thane's Kaman Road railway station for over 90 minutes before charging at the station master. Later, the situation was brought under control by the Government Railway Police (GRP).

338.title: Traffic curbs imposed in Shastripuram for 90 days amid GHMC works
338.article_body: Certain traffic restrictions have been imposed in Hyderabad's Shastripuram area amid grade separator works taken up by the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC). The curbs will be in place for 90 days, from September 1 to November 30, according to a press release. As per reports, vehicle entry will be restricted from Vattepally-Mahmooda Hotel to Mehfil Hotel, Mailardevpally junction.

339.title: Hong Kong cricketer Kinchit proposes to his girlfriend in stadium after India match
339.article_body: Hong Kong batter Kinchit Shah proposed to his girlfriend in the stadium after his team's Asia Cup 2022 match against India in Dubai on Wednesday. A video went viral showing Kinchit going down on one knee and offering the ring to his girlfriend, who accepted his proposal. Fans and his teammates were seen cheering for him during the proposal.

340.title: Police crack ₹3.6 crore cash dacoity case in Pune, 6 arrested
340.article_body: Police arrested six persons in connection with looting cash worth ₹3.6 crore from a car on the Pune-Solapur highway. The incident took place on Friday when the accused intercepted the victim's vehicle, opened fire and escaped with a bag containing cash kept in the boot. "Three of the accused were arrested from Pune...others were arrested from Rajasthan," police said.

341.title: Australia announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
341.article_body: Defending champions Australia have announced their squad for T20 World Cup 2022. Batter Tim David has been included in the 15-member squad. His selection over leg-spinner Mitchell Swepson is the only change from the group that won the T20 World Cup 2021 in the UAE. Australia's T20 World Cup 2022 campaign will begin against New Zealand on October 22.

342.title: Snap CEO confirms 20% job cuts, says 'We must reduce cost to avoid ongoing losses'
342.article_body: In a letter to staff posted on Snap’s website, CEO Evan Spiegel has confirmed 20% job cuts at the company as the latest quarterly revenue growth of 8% was "well below" expectations. Spiegel wrote, "Unfortunately, given our current lower rate of revenue growth, it has become clear that we must reduce our cost structure to avoid incurring significant ongoing losses."

343.title: India's first virtual school was launched by Centre last year, not Delhi govt: NIOS
343.article_body: The Centre-run National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS) has countered Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's claim that his government has launched the first virtual school in the country. The NIOS said the first virtual school of India was launched by it in August 2021, adding that 4.46 lakh assignments were uploaded by the NIOS learners in the recently completed academic session.

344.title: 2 held for killing 40-yr-old man, throwing body on railway track in Delhi
344.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two men for allegedly killing a 40-year-old man while trying to rob him. This comes after police received information that a body was lying on the track between Ghevra and Bahadurgarh railway stations. The accused consumed liquor with the victim following which they attacked him but found only ₹1,020 and an ATM card, police said.

345.title: How do the Asia Cup 2022 points tables read after India's victory against Hong Kong?
345.article_body: With their 40-run victory against Hong Kong in Asia Cup 2022, India confirmed a first-place finish in Group A and advanced to Super 4. Pakistan and Hong Kong, who'll face each other on Friday, are placed second and third, respectively. Meanwhile, Afghanistan are on top of Group B points table, with Bangladesh and Sri Lanka being second and third, respectively.

346.title: I was wondering why he wasn't leaving the field: Suryakumar on Virat Kohli's gesture
346.article_body: On being asked about Virat Kohli bowing down to him and asking him to walk out of the field first after his knock of 68*(26) against Hong Kong, Suryakumar Yadav said, "It was a heartwarming gesture." He added, "I've never seen something like this. I was wondering why he wasn't leaving the field. I loved batting with him."

347.title: Hong Kong gift jersey with handwritten message to Virat Kohli, he shares pic
347.article_body: Hong Kong gifted a jersey with a handwritten message on it to Virat Kohli following their Asia Cup match against India. Kohli took to his Instagram Stories to share a picture of the jersey. "Virat...Thank you for inspiring a generation. We stand with you! There are many incredible days ahead.
