With strength, with love, Team Hong Kong," the message read.

348.title: NASA awards 5 more astronaut missions to ISS to SpaceX worth $1.4 bn
348.article_body: NASA has awarded five additional astronaut missions to the ISS to SpaceX under a $1.4 billion contract order. This brings SpaceX's total contracted missions for its Crew Dragon astronaut capsule to 14. The award "allows NASA to maintain an uninterrupted US capability for human access to the space station until 2030, with two unique commercial crew industry partners," NASA said.

349.title: Green corridor in Delhi helps transport heart across 5.5 km in 4.25 minutes
349.article_body: A green corridor created by Delhi Traffic Police on Wednesday helped transport a heart across 5.5 km in 4.25 minutes. The corridor was created between AIIMS Delhi and Fortis Hospital to transport a 55-year-old brain-dead woman's heart for a 19-year-old boy who has been suffering for 1.5 years. Police said it was challenging task as commuters use the route extensively.

350.title: India beat Hong Kong to reach Asia Cup Super 4 as Suryakumar breaks multiple records
350.article_body: India beat Hong Kong by 40 runs to qualify for Super 4 stage of Asia Cup 2022. Suryakumar Yadav slammed 68*(26), the highest score by a batter in the ongoing tournament. He also recorded most sixes by an Indian (six) in a T20 Asia Cup match and most runs by an Indian (26) in 20th over of a T20I match.

351.title: Bihar Minister Kartikeya Singh, accused in kidnapping case, resigns from his post
351.article_body: Bihar Minister Kartikeya Singh, who is accused in the kidnapping of a builder in 2014, resigned from his post amid protests. Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has accepted his resignation and further sent it to the Governor. Singh was removed as the Law Minister of Bihar and allotted the sugarcane department on Wednesday morning.

352.title: 10-foot-long king cobra hid in car for a week, travelled 200 km in Kerala
352.article_body: A king cobra travelled in a car for over 200 km and lived in its engine bay for a week before being finally rescued by wildlife personnel in Kerala, according to the vehicle owner. The incident was reported from Kerala's Arpookara. The forest officials rescued the 10-foot-long snake from the compound of an individual, a video of which surfaced online.

353.title: Virat Kohli bowls in T20I cricket after 6 years, concedes 6 runs in an over
353.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli on Wednesday bowled an over against Hong Kong in their Asia Cup 2022 match. It is the first time since 2016 that Kohli bowled in a T20I match. He gave away six runs in his over. Kohli has bowled 25.2 overs in T20I cricket, taking four wickets for 204 runs.

354.title: Man steals 1-day-old infant from UP hospital by posing as hospital staff, video surfaces
354.article_body: A CCTV footage has surfaced online showing a man stealing a one-day-old infant from a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. A complaint has been filed by the parents of the infant, in which they mentioned that the man posed as a hospital staff member for stealing the baby. The police has formed a team to nab the accused.

355.title: Nikhil Siddhartha's 'Karthikeya 2' crosses ₹100 crore at box office
355.article_body: Nikhil Siddhartha shared that his film 'Karthikeya 2' has "crossed the ₹100 crore gross mark officially" at the box office. The actor thanked the audience for their "love and affection" for the film. "Will always try and work hard to live up to it," he wrote. The film is being screened on over 3,000 screens across India.

356.title: Michael Jackson wanted to be in The Sandman's TV version: Neil Gaiman
356.article_body: 'The Sandman' author Neil Gaiman revealed that Michael Jackson wanted to play Morpheus in the television version of the comic book series. Remembering his visit to Warner Bros in 1996, Neil said that the then-president of the production house told him that Michael had called them to ask if he could be a part of the television adaptation.

357.title: Would like to work with Vijay in Ajay Gnanamuthu directorial: Vikram
357.article_body: Tamil actor Chiyaan Vikram has shared that he would like to work with his contemporary Vijay under the direction of filmmaker Ajay Gnanamuthu. Vikram spoke about Vijay during a Twitter conversation, which was conducted on Tuesday to promote his film 'Cobra'. In response, director Ajay Gnanamuthu said he would be the first person to buy a ticket for the film.

358.title: Learned how to face camera from Kareena: Kiara
358.article_body: Kiara Advani said she "learned how to face the camera" from her 'Good Newwz' co-star Kareena Kapoor Khan. She said during the film's shoot, she used to be so involved in a scene that she would forget about camera angles. However, that never happened with Kareena. Kiara said Kareena "would know where the camera is, even if it's behind her".

359.title: S Korea may hold survey on BTS members' mandatory military service
359.article_body: South Korea is considering a survey to determine whether members of K-pop band BTS should be granted exemptions from mandatory military service, officials said. The Defence Ministry is examining the adequacy of such a study. The military service issue has been debated in the media recently as BTS's oldest member, Jin, faces enlistment at year-end, when he turns 30.

360.title: EU to toughen travel rules for Russian tourists, no ban imposed
360.article_body: European Union countries on Wednesday agreed to make it tougher for Russian citizens to enter the 27-nation bloc, but failed to develop consensus on imposing an outright ban on tourists. EU foreign ministers made the decision in retaliation to Russia's war on Ukraine. The plan is to lengthen the process to obtain short-term visas to enter Europe's passport-free travel zone.

361.title: Would have quit politics earlier if I knew it would be dirty: Mamata
361.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that she would have quit politics much earlier if she was aware that it could get so dirty and her family and she would face slander. Her statement comes in reaction to a recent PIL filed at Calcutta High Court demanding probe by central agencies into the assets of her family members.

362.title: Dennis Woodside appointed as President of Freshworks
362.article_body: Nasdaq-listed software-as-a-service (SaaS) company Freshworks has appointed Dennis Woodside as the company's President, effective from September 1. Woodside will join the company's board of directors and will report to Freshworks CEO and Founder Girish Mathrubootham. Previously, he was President of Impossible Foods, and also worked at Dropbox and Google. At Freshworks, he will lead global business operations.

363.title: PM Modi performs 'aarti' at Piyush Goyal's residence on Ganesh Chaturthi
363.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi performed 'aarti' at the residence of Union Minister Piyush Goyal on the occasion of Ganesh Chaturthi on Wednesday. A video showed the PM greeting Goyal and others before offering prayers and performing 'aarti'. Sharing pictures from Goyal's residence, the PM tweeted, "May the blessings of Bhagwan Shri Ganesh always remain upon us."

364.title: Crediting Mughals for uniting India 'absurd and false': Baba Ramdev
364.article_body: Responding to Assam Congress MP Abdul Khaliq , who said that the Mughals were responsible for unification of India, Baba Ramdev said that crediting the Mughals for India's unification was 'absurd and false.' Calling the Mughals 'invaders,' Ramdev further added that glorifying them for uniting India 'shows a colonial mindset.' Khaliq had added that he was proud of the Mughals.

365.title: Healthcare facility for advocates to open soon: K'taka CM Bommai
365.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said healthcare facility for advocates would open soon, adding ₹800 crore would be spent to improve the judiciary's infrastructure. "This'll ensure good facilities in lower courts. As the population grows, court facilities must be upgraded," Bommai said. The government has given permission for having the bar associations in Shiggaon, Savanur and Haveri, he added.

366.title: Railways completes construction of 9.8 km tunnel in J&K
366.article_body: A 9.8-km tunnel on the 111-km under-construction Katra-Banihal railway link in Jammu and Kashmir has been completed, officials said. The tunnel connects Dugga and Sawlakote stations. The railway link is part of the 272-km Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Railway Line (USBRL) project. The Katra-Banihal section includes 35 tunnels and 37 bridges.

367.title: Elephant dies at UP's Dudhwa National Park
367.article_body: An elephant, who was suffering from liver complications, has passed away at Uttar Pradesh's Dudhwa National Park, officials said. "The elephant was suffering from liver complications for the past three months," said Field director, Dudhwa, Sanjay Kumar Pathak. He added that the female elephant was given regular medications and despite that her condition did not improve.

368.title: SC to hear plea on mechanism to probe sexual harassment cases against judges
368.article_body: Supreme Court will hear a plea by a law intern on framing guidelines to probe sexual harassment cases against sitting and retired judges in November. It has also sought its Secretary-General's stand on the enquiry mechanism. While hearing the intern's sexual harassment complaint against an ex-judge in 2014, the court had noted that there's no enquiry mechanism for such complaints.

369.title: Hindus, Muslims come together to celebrate Ganesh Chaturthi in K'taka
369.article_body: People from Muslim and Hindu communities came together to celebrate Ganesh Chaturthi in Karnataka's Mandya district on Wednesday. As per reports, people from both the communities had gathered at Beedi Colony, which has a majority of Muslims. A video of their participation in the celebrations has emerged online. Notably, this comes amid Idgah ground dispute in Karnataka's Hubballi and Chamrajpet.

370.title: Internet shutdowns hit Lebanon as telecom workers go on strike
370.article_body: Major internet shutdowns hit cash-strapped Lebanon this week as employees of the state-owned telecom company went on strike, demanding increase in wages. Lebanon is experiencing one of its worst economic crises which has seen three-fourths of its 6-million population enter poverty level. The Lebanese pound lost over 90% of its value against the US dollar in the last three years.

371.title: Excessive flooding could lead to health crisis in Pakistan: WHO
371.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Wednesday warned that the excessive flooding in Pakistan this monsoon could lead to a health crisis. The rains have destroyed or damaged nearly 900 clinics and hospitals and damage to infrastructure has meant health services are not reaching remote areas. WHO has also said there is a possibility of waterborne diseases spreading rapidly.

372.title: No state funeral for Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev: Russian media
372.article_body: There will be no state funeral for the ex-president of the Soviet Union, Mikhail Gorbachev, Russian media reported on Wednesday. Gorbachev's funeral will reportedly take place inside Moscow's House of Unions and he will likely be buried at the city's Novodevichy Cemetery, next to his wife, Raisa, who died in 1999. The funeral will reportedly take place on Saturday.

373.title: Reliance Industries acquires soft drink brand Campa: Report
373.article_body: Reliance Industries has acquired soft drink brand Campa from Pure Drinks Group to add to its FMCG portfolio, as per reports. The deal is estimated to be ₹22 crore and Reliance is looking to re-launch Campa nationally by Diwali in three flavours. This will include its original Campa Cola, lemon and orange variants.

374.title: NPCI receives RBI nod to acquire 10% stake in ONDC
374.article_body: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has received clearance from Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and Union Ministry of Finance to acquire a 10% stake in Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC). Reportedly, Bank of India is also looking to acquire 5-7% stake in the company. ONDC currently has 17 stakeholders, and is aiming to have 20.

375.title: Russian missile strikes kill 22 at train station on Ukraine's Independence Day
375.article_body: At least 22 people were killed and several others wounded in Russian missile strikes on Chaplyne railway station in Ukraine on Wednesday, which was Ukraine's Independence Day. As per Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, rockets also hit a train following which four carriages caught fire. "We'll definitely make the occupiers bear responsibility for everything they have done," Zelenskyy stated.

376.title: BJP, BJYM workers try to gherao Chhattisgarh CM's house; 460 detained
376.article_body: Leaders and workers of BJP and its youth wing BJYM tried to gherao Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel's residence on Wednesday. They were protesting against alleged corruption and unemployment in Chhattisgarh. Police said 461 protesters, including MP Arun Sao, were briefly detained. Around 15 officers were injured while trying to control the protesters at various places in the state, police added.

377.title: Theft suspect in Gujarat's Vadodara dies in police custody
377.article_body: A theft suspect detained in Gujarat's Vadodara died in police custody, an official said. The man, identified as Bhupendra Solanki, was caught while committing theft at a residential society at Sevasi, a police official said. However, a resident of the area said that Solanki was his guest and lost his way when people caught him on suspicion.

378.title: CBI raids residence of Bengal university VC in recruitment scam case
378.article_body: The CBI on Wednesday raided the house and office of former SSC Chairman and present Vice Chancellor of University of North Bengal, Subires Bhattacharyya, in connection with the West Bengal teacher recruitment scam case. Notably, the Bag committee had mentioned Bhattacharyya's name in its report while probing the scam. Earlier, ex-minister Partha Chatterjee was arrested in connection with the case.

379.title: Assam Legislative Assembly autumn session to commence from Sept 12
379.article_body: The autumn session of the Assam Legislative Assembly will commence from September 12 and will continue till September 19. The monsoon session of the Assembly which began on July 18, ended four days ahead of its scheduled end date of August 12. The Governor of Assam, Prof Jagdish Mukhi, summoned the autumn session.

380.title: Even when we remember that today, we can't sleep: Kapil Dev on loss to Pakistan in 1986
380.article_body: Recalling the 1986 Austral-Asia Cup final which India lost to Pakistan after Javed Miandad slammed a last-ball six against Chetan Sharma, former India captain Kapil Dev said, "Even when we remember that today, we can't sleep." He added, "That defeat crushed the whole side's confidence for the next four years." He further said that the defeat wasn't Chetan's mistake.

381.title: It was really good: Danny DeVito on SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'
381.article_body: Actor Danny DeVito said he found SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' and Shahid Kapoor's 'R...Rajkumar' "really good". He said he loved how the Indian films "keep up the story even in the singing". Danny said whenever he can, he would like to convince the makers of his animated show 'Little Demon' to bust into a big number in the next season.

382.title: US sending fresh military aid to Ukraine worth nearly $3 billion
382.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday said he is sending fresh military aid worth $2.98 billion to Ukraine in its war against Russia. Biden said the support will help Ukraine acquire air defense systems, artillery systems, munitions, drones and other equipment. “The United States of America is committed to supporting the people of Ukraine as they...defend their sovereignty,” Biden said.

383.title: What is govt's new model for toll collection on highways?
383.article_body: The government is planning to replace toll plazas with Automatic Number Plate Reader (ANPR) cameras. As per the plan, the cameras will read high-security registration plates (HSRPs) on the vehicles and toll will be automatically deducted from the linked bank accounts of vehicle owners. The government is planning to bring a provision for all vehicles to have HSRPs.

384.title: My focus remains on how relatable my character can be: Pankaj
384.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi said the look of his character doesn't matter to him as an actor. He said his focus remains on creating characters that are so relatable that whenever the audience sees him on screen, they should feel they know someone similar. But for Pankaj, the trick is to do it "while maintaining a certain uniqueness about it".

385.title: F1 driver Daniel Ricciardo to leave McLaren after 2022 season
385.article_body: Formula One driver Daniel Ricciardo has announced that the current 2022 season will be his last year at McLaren. McLaren and Ricciardo have "mutually agreed" to terminate his contract one year early. The Australian had joined McLaren for 2021 on a three-year deal. Ricciardo is the only McLaren driver to have won a Formula One race in the last decade.

386.title: COVID-19 deaths fall by 15% worldwide: WHO in weekly report
386.article_body: The number of COVID-19 deaths dipped by 15% worldwide and new infections dropped by 9%, the World Health Organization (WHO) said in its weekly assessment on Wednesday. In total, the WHO said 5.3 million new cases and over 14,000 deaths were reported last week. The health body said number of new infections fell in every region, except the Western Pacific.

387.title: Nearly 500 schemes announced by Jayalalithaa shelved: AIADMK's EPS
387.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM and AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Wednesday criticised the ruling DMK and accused them of shelving nearly 500 projects announced by late AIADMK leader J Jayalalithaa. This deprives people of various welfare measures, he said. Expansion of Coimbatore airport and Avinashi Athikadavu water project were some of the schemes kept pending, he added.

388.title: TVS Motor buys 48% stake in Narain Karthikeyan’s startup DriveX
388.article_body: Two and three-wheeler manufacturer TVS Motor has invested in former Formula 1 driver Narain Karthikeyan's startup to acquire 48.27% stake. TVS has invested over ₹85 crore in DriveX (NKars Mobility Millennial Solutions Private Limited), a pre-owned two-wheeler platform. DriveX was founded in April 2020 and began as a two-wheeler subscription platform, and has since spread to five cities.

389.title: Pepperfry acquires Brandmakerr, appoints Rahul Kapuria as VP
389.article_body: Furniture e-commerce company Pepperfry has acquired commercial interior solutions company Brandmakerr for an undisclosed amount. Pepperfry has appointed Brandmakerr founder, Rahul Kapuria, as the Vice President. With this deal, Pepperfry said it will foray into commercial projects in retail, banking and HORECA (hotel, restaurant and cafe) sectors as this opens a new area of business for them.

390.title: Tropical Storm Ma-on moves towards southeast China
390.article_body: Tropical Storm Ma-on gathered force and headed towards Hong Kong and other parts of southeast China on Wednesday. Cities in Guangdong province closed high-speed rail and ferry services, workers on sea projects were evacuated and several flights were cancelled. The Hong Kong Observatory warned winds with mean speeds of 63 km/h or more were expected.

391.title: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' to air on TV from Sept 10: Reports
391.article_body: The new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' (TKSS) will reportedly air from September 10. While Archana Puran Singh, Sumona Chakravarti, Kiku Sharda and Chandan Prabhakar will return to the show, Kapil will reportedly introduce new comic actors in the upcoming season. Kapil had recently started shooting for the show. The first episode might host Akshay Kumar.

392.title: Smartphone recovered from woman prisoner in Indore jail, guard suspended
392.article_body: A smartphone was recovered from a 35-year-old woman lodged as an undertrial in the district prison of Madhya Pradesh's Indore, an official said on Wednesday. Following the recovery, a female guard was suspended, the official added. The prisoner was brought to Indore from Tihar Jail as a cheating case is pending against her in a local court, jail's superintendent said.

393.title: Secure release of fishermen arrested by Sri Lanka: Stalin to Centre
393.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday urged the central government to intervene and ensure fishermen arrested by Sri Lanka are released. Stalin wrote to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar after 10 Indian fishermen were arrested and their boats seized on Monday for allegedly poaching in Lankan waters. Stalin said this was the fifth such incident since June this year.

394.title: Yamuna Expressway toll prices increased by up to ₹18.80 per km
394.article_body: Toll tariff on the Yamuna Expressway between Greater Noida and Agra has been increased between ₹2.60 and ₹18.80 per kilometre. Toll for car, jeep, van and light motor vehicles has been increased from ₹2.50 per kilometre to ₹2.65 per kilometre. It has been increased to ₹8.45 for bus or truck, while large size vehicles will be charged ₹18.80 per kilometre.

395.title: Lone JD(U) MLA in Arunachal Pradesh joins ruling BJP
395.article_body: Techi Kaso, the lone JD(U) legislator in Arunachal Pradesh, has joined the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). There are now 49 BJP MLAs in the 60-member state Assembly. This comes after Bihar CM Nitish Kumar-led JD(U) broke alliance with BJP in Bihar. JD(U) had won seven seats in the 2019 state elections. However, six JD(U) MLAs joined BJP in 2020.

396.title: We'll continue protests till Raja Singh is arrested: AIMIM chief Owaisi
396.article_body: Condemning Telangana BJP MLA T Raja Singh's alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday demanded his arrest. "BJP and their MLA T Raja Singh issued a video expressing their hate against Prophet Muhammad," he said. "The Prophet lives in the hearts of Muslims...We will continue our protests till this MLA is arrested," he added.

397.title: Chile govt revives efforts to pass bill aimed to reduce working hours
397.article_body: The Chilean government said on Tuesday that it has revived efforts to pass legislation that would reduce weekly working hours. The bill, which aims to reduce the working week from 45 hours to 40 hours, was first introduced in the country's Congress in 2017. Lawmakers will debate a series of changes to the bill made by President Gabriel Boric's government.

398.title: Hyd court serves notice to BJP leaders in Kavitha's defamation case
398.article_body: A Hyderabad court served a notice to BJP leaders Parvesh Verma and Manjinder Sirsa in a defamation case filed by TRS MLC K Kavitha. Kavitha, who is Telangana CM Chandrashekar Rao's daughter, was accused of being the middleman between the liquor mafia and the Delhi government. The court directed the BJP leaders to not make defamatory statements in the media.

399.title: Virat Kohli meets Babar Azam ahead of India-Pakistan match, pic goes viral
399.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli met Pakistan captain Babar Azam at the stadium, where both the teams are preparing for their Asia Cup 2022 encounter, which will take place on August 28. The picture of the duo went viral on social media, with a fan writing, "Picture of the day." "Babar and Virat broke the internet," wrote another.

400.title: The idea of 'Liger' came to me because of Allu Arjun: Puri Jagannadh
400.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh credited Allu Arjun for the idea behind 'Liger'. He said during the film 'Iddarammayilatho' (2013), Allu Arjun told him about a Hollywood director whose heroes always had some sort of disability. Puri said Arjun asked him to write such a character. "I suggested a hero who stammers and he liked it. That's how it started," he recalled.

401.title: Terrorism is 'crime against humanity': Rajnath Singh at SCO meet
401.article_body: Every form of terrorism, including cross-border terrorism, is a "crime against humanity", Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said at a Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) meet in Tashkent on Wednesday. Singh added that Afghan territory must not be used for terror activities. The SCO member states are India, China, Russia, Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan and Pakistan.

402.title: BJP's Vijay Kumar Sinha named LoP in Bihar Assembly after resigning as Speaker
402.article_body: Senior BJP leader and former Bihar Assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Sinha was named as the Leader of the Opposition on Wednesday. Sinha resigned as the Speaker ahead of floor test on Wednesday morning. Earlier, the Leader of the Opposition was RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, who is now the Deputy Chief Minister of Bihar.

403.title: The single hardest thing in my life: Vijay on Tollywood debut
403.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said "probably the single hardest thing" in his life was to find a platform as an actor. Vijay said after finishing theatre, he thought of making his debut as a Tollywood actor but there was nowhere to go and "nobody was looking". He said he never lost hope and always believed he was meant for "something big".
